I was reading this story where y/n is avoiding Harry after coming back from your tour or something like that because she's pregnant and doesn't wanna tell him but he feels hurt/angry but I got a call and when I finished the call my tumblr refreshed and now I can't find it to finish reading it
answer: Does anyone know what fic this is?

summary: We'll close the year soon, so I wanna thank everyone who read my stories, liked them, reblogged them, left feedback, became my...
body:
We’ll close the year soon, so I wanna thank everyone who read my stories, liked them, reblogged them, left feedback, became my friend, and was with me this year. I’ll be back in January with oh-so-many stories I haven’t told yet. Spoilers! Harry one shots, new chapters for Sidekick of a Superstar, Long Way Forward, Keeping Up With the Unit, and other stories I am currently writing to publish them next year. You’ll get the next chapter of Keeping Up With the Unit this Sunday, and after that we’ll meet in January again.

Don’t forget to stay hydrated. Love you all, R.

Special thanks to my favourite blogs: @therockstarprince @all-the-love-harold @harrywavycurly @gooberforgubler80 @harrysofluffy @drunkirkharry and basically everyone I follow ❤

summary: hi so i was scrolling through my explore page on instagram and chanced upon a post that asked if people honestly still think...
body:
hi so i was scrolling through my explore page on instagram and chanced upon a post that asked if people honestly still think that 1d would get back together and i feel so discouraged looking at the responses? i’ve always believed they would keep their promises but i feel so alone in this belief now? sigh i don’t know


could you tell me if you honestly, honestly think they’re coming back?

title: The Spark-Part 2
body:
That night, Harry decided to go out with his friends. These days, he rarely went out to clubs. He spent his free time at home, or with family. Today, however, he wanted to get the beautiful y/n out of his mind.

The whole gang was in attendance. It was Harry’s, unofficial, celebration of his debut album. The album had been widely popular and extremely successful. Harry had been over the moon. Part of him worried that people wouldn’t like his new sound, and another part of him felt like his fans wouldn’t accept him without the other boys.

He had struggled with mixed emotions ever since the band had went their separate ways. He missed his mates dearly and wished things could have turned out differently. However, he wished them all nothing but the best! He would always be one of their biggest fans, cheering them on from the sidelines.

Harry sipped on his whiskey, as he watched his friends chatting. There were nothing but laughs between the lot of them. He enjoyed moments like this and wished he could have them more often. He knew he needed to take some more time for himself.

He was lost in deep thought, when Mitch nudged him. “Hey Harry. Isn’t that your girlfriend?” He teased.

Harry’s head shot up and turned in the direction he was pointing. Sure enough, the stunning y/n stood in the corner with a group of her friends. She was wearing a tight black dress and had her hair down up in a bun.

To Mitch’s great pleasure, Harry blushed ever so slightly.

“Wait!” Sarah chimed in. “What did I miss?? What is this about a girlfriend, Harry??”

“It’s nothing!” Harry groaned shooting Mitch a dirty look.

“Our young heart throb here is in loveee.” Mitch chuckled.

“In love??” Sarah asked wide eyed “Sounds serious. Well go on with it, tell us about her.”

Downing the rest of his drink, Harry smirked. “You know I would, but I need a refill.”

He stood up and headed to the bar. He smiled when he heard his friends protests from behind him. He was certain that Mitch would fill them all in, while he was gone.

Harry ordered his drink, and waited at the bar. Out of the corner of his eye, he noticed the girl approach. She stood in front of the bar, just to the left of Harry. He watched her give her order the bartender. She was getting drinks for the entire group. She looked slightly flushed from the alcohol, and it made her all the more alluring.

When his drink was made, Harry made a decision. Discreetly he asked the man behind the counter to pay for both his and her drinks for the night. Giving him a smile, he took the card willingly.

The girl was beyond surprised, when her drinks were ready. She reached in her pocket, but was stopped and told what had happened. Although the bartender didn’t mention a name, she turned her head to both sides and then spotted Harry.

It wouldn’t have been obvious that it was him, if not for him staring. Embarrassed, he gave her a shake of his head and turned back to the front.

“You didn’t have to do that, you know.” She spoke softly from beside him.

Shocked he turned her way. “Was it that obvious?” He said coolly.

Laughing slightly, she shook her head. Her eyes were dancing with excitement, as Harry watched on. “Well, although highly unnecessary, thank you for the kind gesture.” She told him sincerely.

“The pleasure is all mine, love.” He told her honestly.

Hearing her friends calling her name, she briefly turned away. “Well I guess I should be getting back to my friends,” she told him. He wasn’t sure, but he thought he saw sadness in her eyes. She gave him a warm smile. “Thanks again for the drinks. I hope you have a goodnight Harry.”

Hearing his name roll of her tongue so smoothly, made his heart skip a beat. He watched her walk back to her group, longingly.

She confounded him. She conformed that she had known his identity, yet she still treated him like any other person. He found it to be quite refreshing, a nice and welcomed change.

He watched her for a moment longer. Noticing her talking to Eric, he started to get panicky. He had known that Eric would tell her of their encounter, and he had hoped that she wouldn’t find him strange. When Eric pointed in Harry’s direction, his face grew red.

He decided to return to his friends. He wanted to disappear into the crowd, or rather have a hole open in the floor and swallow him whole.

His friends were still laughing and caring on at his expense. They, without a doubt, had seen what had gone on at the bar. Before long, he had become restless. He decided that it was time to call it a night. He wanted to get out of there before y/n decided to confront him.

Telling his friends goodbye, he quickly made his way to the exit. Without a backward glance, he left the club.


*********************************************

YOUR POINT OF VIEW


Against your better judgment, you decided to join Eric at the club. He had begged and pleaded with you for the better part of the day. You were beyond exhausted from the extra hours you had been putting in at work, but he wasn’t taking no for an answer.

You decided to take pity on him and agreed to have one drink with him. You got dressed up, deciding to spend extra care on your appearance. Normally, you didn’t care how you looked. However, you had a feeling something might happen tonight.

It had seemed like you were seeing Harry Styles everywhere you turned. You had always been a big fan of his, ever since his one direction days. You had secretly had the biggest crush on him, and he had definitely been way more handsome in person.

You had hoped to have a quiet evening in, maybe with a glass of wine. However, you found yourself in one of the most popular clubs in town. You were already a bit tipsy. Your friends had convinced you to take a few shoots already. Deciding to let lose a bit, you gave in.

You hadn’t been paying much attention to the large crowd of people, so you had not noticed Harry sitting at the bar alone. Eric declared you the next person to grab drinks for the group and with a sigh you agreed.

Walking up to the bar, you were looking towards the ground. Lost in a daze, you gave your order to the young man behind the counter. He gave you a friendly smile, as he went to fetch your drinks.

You stared at the wall, as you waited. You were getting rather tired from the alcohol and knew you should be calling it a night. You had work early in the morning and had never been a morning person.

The bartender arrived with your drinks quickly. Reaching in your pocket you started to give him your card. He stopped you and shook his hand. Confused you listened as he explained.

“That wont be necessary,” he assured you. “It’s been taken care of.”

Looking around, you wondered who on earth would have done this for you. You noticed from the corner of your eyes a man glancing your way. Upon further inspection you froze. Harry was just off to your right, staring your way. He gave you a shy smile and turned the other way.

Boldly you decided to thank him. Approaching him, you smiled. It must have been all the alcohol that had given you the courage. You would normally never do something like this.

“You didn’t have to do that, you know.” You spoke softly from beside him.

“Was it that obvious?” He said coolly.

Laughing slightly, you shook your head. He gave you a smirk, and you tried your best to keep your cool. “Well, although highly unnecessary, thank you for the kind gesture.” You told him sincerely.

“The pleasure is all mine, love.” He told you honestly.

Hearing your friends calling your name, you turned towards them automatically. “Well I guess I should be getting back to my friends,” you told him a bit disappointed. “Thanks again for the drinks. I hope you have a goodnight Harry.” You told him giving him a warm smile.

Turning away, you carried the drinks back to your group.

“What was all that about?” Eric asked curious.

“What do you mean?”

“I saw you talking to that guy at the bar.”

“Oh.. Yeah.. It was nothing,” you told him casually. Taking a sip of your drink, you hoped he would drop the subject.

“Do you know him?”

You raised your brows, “Don’t you?”

“No? Should I?”

“That’s Harry Styles.” When he still looked at you confused, you continued. “He’s an extremely talented singer and songwriter. Any of this ringing a bell?”

“I can’t say that it is.”

“Oh come on! I play his music for you all the time!” You told him exasperated.

“Ohhh yeahhh I remember that crap you torture me with.”

“It’s not crap! It’s amazing and beautiful. I can’t help it if you don’t have good taste in music.” You tell him a bit offended.

“Whatever you say.” He said automatically. “So what did he want?”

“He didn’t want anything,” you said annoyed.

“Yeah right,” he said with a snort.

“And what is that suppose to mean?”

“Look all I know is that I don’t like the guy. There’s something off about him. He asked about you today, you know.”

“What wait?”

“Today, after you left the coffee house, he came up to me and asked me where you worked.”

You thought that over for a moment. ‘Harry Styles wanted to know where you worked? How strange.’

“Hmm..” You stated simply.

“I think he fancies you.”

“Eric, no one says fancies anymore,” you tease. “Besides, I’m sure your wrong.”

“I doubt it,” he muttered. “You’re quite the catch, even if you don’t see it.”

At this, you were not sure what to say. You had always known how Eric felt about you, but you were never able to return the affection. It killed you knowing that you hurt him by not loving him in the way that he so clearly wanted. However, your heart just wasn’t into him. You couldn’t help the way you felt.

“Well.. I should really be calling it a night,” you told him changing the subject.

“What? No! You can’t go yet, it’s only 11!”

“Yes, but some of us have to be up at 6 a.m to open the store.”

“Fine,” he muttered pouting.

“Oh don’t give me that! You better just be glad I came out, even when I’m beyond exhausted.”

“I know, I know. Coffee tomorrow?”

“Always,” you confirmed with a smile.

Giving him a peck on the cheek, you told the rest of your friends goodbye. Upon leaving, you scanned the room. A part of you had hoped Harry was still there, and you could talk to him once more. However, to your disappointment, he was no where in sight. Sighing you left the club and walked the short distance to your apartment.

That night, you fell into a fitful sleep. Your dreams consisted of piercing emerald eyes, and smoldering looks. It was not the first time you had a dream of Harry, but there was something different about this one. It seemed to be more intense, more real.

@titanicbuff1912

He stood up and headed to the bar. He smiled when he heard his friends protests from behind him. He was certain that Mitch would fill them all in, while he was gone.

Harry ordered his drink, and waited at the bar. Out of the corner of his eye, he noticed the girl approach. She stood in front of the bar, just to the left of Harry. He watched her give her order the bartender. She was getting drinks for the entire group. She looked slightly flushed from the alcohol, and it made her all the more alluring.

When his drink was made, Harry made a decision. Discreetly he asked the man behind the counter to pay for both his and her drinks for the night. Giving him a smile, he took the card willingly.

The girl was beyond surprised, when her drinks were ready. She reached in her pocket, but was stopped and told what had happened. Although the bartender didn’t mention a name, she turned her head to both sides and then spotted Harry.

It wouldn’t have been obvious that it was him, if not for him staring. Embarrassed, he gave her a shake of his head and turned back to the front.

“You didn’t have to do that, you know.” She spoke softly from beside him.

Shocked he turned her way. “Was it that obvious?” He said coolly.

Laughing slightly, she shook her head. Her eyes were dancing with excitement, as Harry watched on. “Well, although highly unnecessary, thank you for the kind gesture.” She told him sincerely.

“The pleasure is all mine, love.” He told her honestly.

Hearing her friends calling her name, she briefly turned away. “Well I guess I should be getting back to my friends,” she told him. He wasn’t sure, but he thought he saw sadness in her eyes. She gave him a warm smile. “Thanks again for the drinks. I hope you have a goodnight Harry.”

Hearing his name roll of her tongue so smoothly, made his heart skip a beat. He watched her walk back to her group, longingly.

She confounded him. She conformed that she had known his identity, yet she still treated him like any other person. He found it to be quite refreshing, a nice and welcomed change.

He watched her for a moment longer. Noticing her talking to Eric, he started to get panicky. He had known that Eric would tell her of their encounter, and he had hoped that she wouldn’t find him strange. When Eric pointed in Harry’s direction, his face grew red.

He decided to return to his friends. He wanted to disappear into the crowd, or rather have a hole open in the floor and swallow him whole.

His friends were still laughing and caring on at his expense. They, without a doubt, had seen what had gone on at the bar. Before long, he had become restless. He decided that it was time to call it a night. He wanted to get out of there before y/n decided to confront him.

Telling his friends goodbye, he quickly made his way to the exit. Without a backward glance, he left the club.


*********************************************

YOUR POINT OF VIEW


Against your better judgment, you decided to join Eric at the club. He had begged and pleaded with you for the better part of the day. You were beyond exhausted from the extra hours you had been putting in at work, but he wasn’t taking no for an answer.

You decided to take pity on him and agreed to have one drink with him. You got dressed up, deciding to spend extra care on your appearance. Normally, you didn’t care how you looked. However, you had a feeling something might happen tonight.

It had seemed like you were seeing Harry Styles everywhere you turned. You had always been a big fan of his, ever since his one direction days. You had secretly had the biggest crush on him, and he had definitely been way more handsome in person.

You had hoped to have a quiet evening in, maybe with a glass of wine. However, you found yourself in one of the most popular clubs in town. You were already a bit tipsy. Your friends had convinced you to take a few shoots already. Deciding to let lose a bit, you gave in.

You hadn’t been paying much attention to the large crowd of people, so you had not noticed Harry sitting at the bar alone. Eric declared you the next person to grab drinks for the group and with a sigh you agreed.

Walking up to the bar, you were looking towards the ground. Lost in a daze, you gave your order to the young man behind the counter. He gave you a friendly smile, as he went to fetch your drinks.

You stared at the wall, as you waited. You were getting rather tired from the alcohol and knew you should be calling it a night. You had work early in the morning and had never been a morning person.

The bartender arrived with your drinks quickly. Reaching in your pocket you started to give him your card. He stopped you and shook his hand. Confused you listened as he explained.

“That wont be necessary,” he assured you. “It’s been taken care of.”

Looking around, you wondered who on earth would have done this for you. You noticed from the corner of your eyes a man glancing your way. Upon further inspection you froze. Harry was just off to your right, staring your way. He gave you a shy smile and turned the other way.

Boldly you decided to thank him. Approaching him, you smiled. It must have been all the alcohol that had given you the courage. You would normally never do something like this.

“You didn’t have to do that, you know.” You spoke softly from beside him.

“Was it that obvious?” He said coolly.

Laughing slightly, you shook your head. He gave you a smirk, and you tried your best to keep your cool. “Well, although highly unnecessary, thank you for the kind gesture.” You told him sincerely.

“The pleasure is all mine, love.” He told you honestly.

Hearing your friends calling your name, you turned towards them automatically. “Well I guess I should be getting back to my friends,” you told him a bit disappointed. “Thanks again for the drinks. I hope you have a goodnight Harry.” You told him giving him a warm smile.

Turning away, you carried the drinks back to your group.

“What was all that about?” Eric asked curious.

“What do you mean?”

“I saw you talking to that guy at the bar.”

“Oh.. Yeah.. It was nothing,” you told him casually. Taking a sip of your drink, you hoped he would drop the subject.

“Do you know him?”

You raised your brows, “Don’t you?”

“No? Should I?”

“That’s Harry Styles.” When he still looked at you confused, you continued. “He’s an extremely talented singer and songwriter. Any of this ringing a bell?”

“I can’t say that it is.”

“Oh come on! I play his music for you all the time!” You told him exasperated.

“Ohhh yeahhh I remember that crap you torture me with.”

“It’s not crap! It’s amazing and beautiful. I can’t help it if you don’t have good taste in music.” You tell him a bit offended.

“Whatever you say.” He said automatically. “So what did he want?”

“He didn’t want anything,” you said annoyed.

“Yeah right,” he said with a snort.

“And what is that suppose to mean?”

“Look all I know is that I don’t like the guy. There’s something off about him. He asked about you today, you know.”

“What wait?”

“Today, after you left the coffee house, he came up to me and asked me where you worked.”

You thought that over for a moment. ‘Harry Styles wanted to know where you worked? How strange.’

“Hmm..” You stated simply.

“I think he fancies you.”

“Eric, no one says fancies anymore,” you tease. “Besides, I’m sure your wrong.”

“I doubt it,” he muttered. “You’re quite the catch, even if you don’t see it.”

At this, you were not sure what to say. You had always known how Eric felt about you, but you were never able to return the affection. It killed you knowing that you hurt him by not loving him in the way that he so clearly wanted. However, your heart just wasn’t into him. You couldn’t help the way you felt.

“Well.. I should really be calling it a night,” you told him changing the subject.

“What? No! You can’t go yet, it’s only 11!”

“Yes, but some of us have to be up at 6 a.m to open the store.”

“Fine,” he muttered pouting.

“Oh don’t give me that! You better just be glad I came out, even when I’m beyond exhausted.”

“I know, I know. Coffee tomorrow?”

“Always,” you confirmed with a smile.

Giving him a peck on the cheek, you told the rest of your friends goodbye. Upon leaving, you scanned the room. A part of you had hoped Harry was still there, and you could talk to him once more. However, to your disappointment, he was no where in sight. Sighing you left the club and walked the short distance to your apartment.

That night, you fell into a fitful sleep. Your dreams consisted of piercing emerald eyes, and smoldering looks. It was not the first time you had a dream of Harry, but there was something different about this one. It seemed to be more intense, more real.

@titanicbuff1912
trail.content:
That night, Harry decided to go out with his friends. These days, he rarely went out to clubs. He spent his free time at home, or with family. Today, however, he wanted to get the beautiful y/n out of his mind.

The whole gang was in attendance. It was Harry’s, unofficial, celebration of his debut album. The album had been widely popular and extremely successful. Harry had been over the moon. Part of him worried that people wouldn’t like his new sound, and another part of him felt like his fans wouldn’t accept him without the other boys.

He had struggled with mixed emotions ever since the band had went their separate ways. He missed his mates dearly and wished things could have turned out differently. However, he wished them all nothing but the best! He would always be one of their biggest fans, cheering them on from the sidelines.

Harry sipped on his whiskey, as he watched his friends chatting. There were nothing but laughs between the lot of them. He enjoyed moments like this and wished he could have them more often. He knew he needed to take some more time for himself.

He was lost in deep thought, when Mitch nudged him. “Hey Harry. Isn’t that your girlfriend?” He teased.

Harry’s head shot up and turned in the direction he was pointing. Sure enough, the stunning y/n stood in the corner with a group of her friends. She was wearing a tight black dress and had her hair down up in a bun.

To Mitch’s great pleasure, Harry blushed ever so slightly.

“Wait!” Sarah chimed in. “What did I miss?? What is this about a girlfriend, Harry??”

“It’s nothing!” Harry groaned shooting Mitch a dirty look.

“Our young heart throb here is in loveee.” Mitch chuckled.

“In love??” Sarah asked wide eyed “Sounds serious. Well go on with it, tell us about her.”

Downing the rest of his drink, Harry smirked. “You know I would, but I need a refill.”

He stood up and headed to the bar. He smiled when he heard his friends protests from behind him. He was certain that Mitch would fill them all in, while he was gone.

Harry ordered his drink, and waited at the bar. Out of the corner of his eye, he noticed the girl approach. She stood in front of the bar, just to the left of Harry. He watched her give her order the bartender. She was getting drinks for the entire group. She looked slightly flushed from the alcohol, and it made her all the more alluring.

He watched her for a moment longer. Noticing her talking to Eric, he started to get panicky. He had known that Eric would tell her of their encounter, and he had hoped that she wouldn’t find him strange. When Eric pointed in Harry’s direction, his face grew red.

He decided to return to his friends. He wanted to disappear into the crowd, or rather have a hole open in the floor and swallow him whole.

His friends were still laughing and caring on at his expense. They, without a doubt, had seen what had gone on at the bar. Before long, he had become restless. He decided that it was time to call it a night. He wanted to get out of there before y/n decided to confront him.

Telling his friends goodbye, he quickly made his way to the exit. Without a backward glance, he left the club.

summary: Это было в прологе к Red, а потом она написала 1989...
body:
Это было в прологе к Red, а потом она написала 1989…

«… можно гордиться тем, что ты двигаешься дальше и осознаешь, что настоящая любовь сияет золотом, как звездный свет, и не тускнеет и не сгорает спонтанно. Может быть, я напишу целый альбом о такой любви, если когда-нибудь найду ее».

And there’s something to be proud of about moving on and realizing that real love shines golden like starlight, and doesn’t fade or spontaneously combust. Maybe I’ll write a whole album about that kind of love if I ever find it. But this album is about the other kids of love that I’ve recently fallen in and out of. Love that was treacherous, sad, beautiful, and tragic. But most of all, this record is about love that was red.
